entry.title: [GPU][Android] Simplify CodecImage's tracking of GPU memory being used
entry.content:
CodecBufferOutputRenderer currently tracks whether the tex image was

bound when rendering to the front buffer. This information is used only

by CodecImage to determine whether GPU memory is being used for metrics.



CodecBufferOutputRenderer marks the tex image as bound iff:



* the image was rendered to the front buffer and

* either (1) the rendering is part of an explicit binding flow (as

specified by the caller), or (2) the render is part of a normally

non-binding flow but the TextureOwner always binds on update (since

rendering triggers a call to TextureOwner::UpdateImage())



CodecImage is the only caller that specifies that the flow is explicitly

binding, and CodecImage also has the information of whether the image

has been rendered to the front buffer as well as whether the

TextureOwner always binds on update. Hence, CodecImage can internally

track the necessary information, which enables simplifying this code and

removing the concept of StreamTextureSharedImageInterface::BindingsMode

entirely.



Note that this CL adds a couple of method calls in places where they

don't currently exist, each of which has to handle objects potentially

being null. We document (a) why these method calls are safe (won't lead

to crashes), and (b) why they're correct (match current behavior in

cases where the objects on which invocation is desired are null):



* CodecImage::UpdateAndBindTexImage() now calls

was_rendered_to_front_buffer(). This method will safely return false

if `output_buffer_renderer_` doesn't exist, in which case

CodecBufferOutputRenderer::RenderToTextureOwnerFrontBuffer() will also

not have been invoked.

* CodecImage::IsUsingGpuMemory() now calls

was_rendered_to_front_buffer() and TextureOwnerBindsOnUpdate(). The

former returns false if `output_buffer_renderer_` does not exist, in

which case the current code also returns false. The latter returns

false if either `output_buffer_renderer_` doesn't exist or if the

TextureOwner doesn't exist. TextureOwner will only not exist if

CodecBufferOutputRenderer doesn't have a

`codec_buffer_wait_coordinator_`, which itself is the case only if

overlays are being used. In that case,

CodecBufferOutputRenderer::RenderToTextureOwnerFrontBuffer() will

short-circuit out in the current code, meaning that the image will

never be rendered to the front buffer and hence returning false

matches current behavior.



Finally, this CL changes TextureOwnerBindsTextureOnUpdate() to check

for texture_owner() being non-null rather than

`output_buffer_renderer_`. The former check returns nullptr iff either

`output_buffer_renderer_` is null *or*

output_buffer_renderer_->texture_owner() is null. As

TextureOwnerBindsTextureOnUpdate() calls into

output_buffer_renderer_->texture_owner(), it was both (a) necessary to

make this change in this CL (in case CodecImage::IsUsingGpuMemory() is

called in a case where overlays are being used and there is hence no

TextureOwner), and (b) a correct change to make in any case (the current

code will crash if TextureOwnerBindsTextureOnUpdate() is ever called

with no TextureOwner present).



Bug: 1466805

Change-Id: I41720b437c8cdbb498358ee1ff1ef43b10be8c5a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4710626

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Reviewed-by: vikas soni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175546}

entry.title: WebUI: Include all WebUIMochaBrowserTest tests on Windows cross builds.
entry.content:
Previously all WebUI tests were not included in Windows cross builds,

because js2gtest was not compatible with such builds

(crbug.com/1010561). Newer WebUI tests no longer use js2gtest and

therefore can be successfully built on cross builds.



Splitting include_js_tests flag to two separate flags

- include_js_tests

- include_js2gtest_tests



to allow differentiating between old and new tests, and hooking it up

to the chrome/test/data/webui:{browser_tests,interactive_ui_tests}

targets.

entry.title: Remove redundant existence check in PathService
entry.content:
Callers of PathService::OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded may ask it to ensure

that the given path exists as a directory. Chrome's

InitializeUserDataDir uses this to set the path for

chrome::DIR_USER_DATA on the basis of command line or enterprise policy

options. Since base::CreateDirectory itself will return true if the

given path already exists as a directory, and will return false if the

given path either names a file or such a directory cannot be created,

there is no need for OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded to make any checks on the

path before calling CreateDirectory. Doing so is only wasted I/O and can

lead to filesystem races.



Bug: 1336338

Change-Id: If0b910f90ce5d89af56731edd6fb7d0787124a6d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685555

entry.title: Clang: enable unwind tables on Apple
entry.content:
On Mac, we suffer infrequent but regular unreproducible linkrt crashes

on the bots. The stack trace is typically an "impossible" one like

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1356378#c20



This same stack trace popped up deterministically in

https://crbug.com/1466674. I was able to use this repro to determine

that the bogus stack traces are caused by not enabling unwind tables.



Per https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1597170

this saves 900k on the archive size (probably more by now), but I'd

like to re-enable them at least temporarily to solve the ongoing

crashes.



Bug: 1356378

entry.title: cros_next: Initializing button icons properly
entry.content:
My last CL https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4659684 makes chrome frame

caption buttons not shown on Linux. It's caused by that the browser

frame view tries to initialize the buttons before the frame view is

added to a widget. And we early early in FrameCaptionButton::SetImage if

the widget is not there yet.



In order to fix it, we remove the widget check in the SetImage function

to let the button icons and icon definition to be initialized properly.

Also in SetImage, we don't trigger the paint until the button is added

to a widget.





Fixed: 1467467

Change-Id: Ife3fb2bfbc6d52ac128e2fcb191907cd1ec2f2f6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4718194

Commit-Queue: Prudhvikumar Bommana

Reviewed-by: Toshiki Kikuchi

Reviewed-by: Sammie Quon

entry.title: Revert "Revert "webauthn: don't prelink in work profiles.""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8c4a5b4e16, which effectively relands d0cc56ee24.



It was reverted the first time because checking if a process is in a

work profile is seemingly so expensive that it caused benchmark

regressions. This reland a) caches the result in the profile, so we'll

only check once per install, and b) defers checking for three minutes to

avoid the contended startup period.



Low-Coverage-Reason: not possible short of full-system tests.

correct arguments.

entry.title: Show permission usage in PageInfo
entry.content:
This CL adds new strings in PageInfo that indicate if a permission is

in use or was used in the last 24 hours. Permissions usage and last

used time are stored in `PageSpecificContentSettings` and saved in

PageSpecificContentSettings's dtor to make sure if the last used time

gets updated multiple times it has no impact on Chrome's speed.



That feature is gated behind `kImprovedSemanticsActivityIndicators`

flag.



More details here:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RQ8Ac7EXsRioj-mXXuD5ZJGmV04V-mDaj62MXjx2BX8/edit#heading=h.5af6aou8qh0m

entry.title: Put `//components/qr_code_generator` into `qr_code_generator` namespace.
entry.content:
This CL puts the C++ code under `//components/qr_code_generator` into

the `qr_code_generator`. This is motivated by the desire to:



1. Follow the C++ style guide:

https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Namespaces:

"With few exceptions, place code in a namespace."



2. Ensure that the C++/Rust FFI of QR code generator is a good role

model for replicating in future C++/Rust projects. In particular,

this CL add the namespace to

`#[cxx::bridge(namespace = "qr_code_generator")]`.



To keep the scope of this CL small, we avoid changing:



A. The `dino_image` namespace used by

`//components/qr_code_generator/dino_image.h`.



B. The `qrcode_generator` namespace used by

`//chrome/services/qrcode_generator`.



Bug: 1431991

Change-Id: I5d45188f535933e71573aabbc3a7d8b3f9215ec7

entry.title: [lacros-a11y]: add initial support for Ash-driven C++ Lacros SpokenFeedbackTests
entry.content:
This change adds the needed setup for SpokenFeedbackTests to launch a

Lacros browser whenever a url is opened.



In addition, it adds a new helper `NavigateToUrl` which opens the given

url in either Lacros or Ash depending on whether the

`--lacros-chrome-path` got passed to Chrome (via AshBrowserTestStarter).



Note that these tests could be driven by a Lacros binary (browser test)

if they get invoked (after a mojo IPC) and report back results with

minimal changes required and backward compat when run through an Ash

browser test.



Finally, a subset of tests are left for follow ups (see

linux-chromeos.browser_tests.require_lacros.filter).

entry.title: [FedCM] Use CCT for showModalDialog() part 2
entry.content:
This CL finalizes Android support for the IDP sign-in via a CCT. The

flow is a bit different from desktop:

1. showModalDialog() is invoked on the opener, which launches a CCT.

This also adds an ActivityStateObserver to detect when the CCT has

been closed. We also notify the AccountSelectionMediator to ensure

that it does not attempt to show the bubble while the CCT is open.

2. closeModalDialog() is invoked on the CCT directly, so that we may

query the delegate using the static mapping and the FedCM ID of the

intent. We call onModalDialogClosed() on the opener, which notifies

the mediator and cancels the activity observer. When the opener

becomes interactable again, we will show the FedCM UI.

3. If the CCT is instead closed some other way, the opener is notified

via onActivityResumed(), so that it may invoke onDismissed() to send

the termination of the flow to the JavaScript API.



To make this change work:

* We now receive the WebContents in the creator of

IdentityRequestDialogController instead of the individual methods, as

we want it on CloseModalDialog() in the Android case.

* We no longer attempt to destroy and recreate the Java Bridge when a

show method is invoked. This is so that the object which receives the

second show (once the IDP signin occurs and the second accounts fetch

happens) is the same as the first one, and the flow works as intended.

entry.title: Wait for ThreadPool in PromoService tests
entry.content:
With the introduction of the Rust JSON parser, JSON parsing is now

performed in the thread pool and not in a separate process. This means

tests must wait for tasks in the thread pool to complete, and

TaskEnvironment supports this in its QUEUED mode.

entry.title: Integrate the account reconciler with the FedCM IDP Sign-in Status
entry.content:
FedCM keeps track of whether the user is signed in to an IDP or not.

However, particularly on Android and ChromeOS, users do not sign in

to google.com directly with the browser, so this CL registers

an IdentityManager observer to get notified when the accounts in the

GAIA cookie change and updates the stored IDP signin status

accordingly.



See also:

https://github.com/fedidcg/FedCM/blob/main/proposals/idp-sign-in-status-api.md

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wMHA9o39cALh_hO40WJPbUK-xbG_qwY4MaC12yFuZZ4/edit?pli=1&resourcekey=0-JuS3S03j1VRG-9TC9bKPWg

entry.title: [Telemetry] Add interfaces for interacting with a routine
entry.content:
This CL adds the interface for creating and interacting with a running

routine to both cros_healthd and crosapi. The crosapi implementation

will be added in subsequent patches while the cros_healthd

implementation was introduced in the following CLs (ChromiumOS):

- crrev.com/c/4045526: RoutineControl

- crrev.com/c/4055138: Example implementation of RoutineObserver

- crrev.com/c/4358453: RoutinesService



This is part of a bigger effort to add a new diagnostics interface

to the Telemetry Extension. For more context visit

go/dd-telemetry-extension-diag-revisit.

entry.title: [DBSC] Use minimum cookie expiration time
entry.content:
The user must be protected in both 1P and 3P context, therefore DBSC

needs to support multiple cookies (1P + 3P).This is step 3 of adding

support for multiple DBSC cookies. In this CL, we move computing

BoundSessionParams to the controller, and rely on the minimum cookie

expiration time of the 1P & 3P cookies for scheduling refreshes and

blocking requests.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 32f8ef17b71e07b0ebd566fdc6b29e5527bf095d.



Reason for revert: Tests seem to be failing again after reland



Original change's description:

> Reland "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"

>

> This reverts commit 5f2a690589d8aaaa71181560acc2d70150773037.

>

> Reason for revert: The revert of another CL fixed test failure. This CL is not related.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Revert "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"

> >

> > This reverts commit f0db7b86166ef32ecdfbcb2a72e4a0abe6189db8.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Seems to be causing multiple failures:

> > crbug.com/1467734

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > [customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code

> > >

> > > Chrome Refresh requires the Customize Chrome side panel. This CL ensures

> > > that Chrome Refresh is only enabled if Customize Chrome is enabled, too.

> > >

> > > Additionally, this CL introduces a new feature flag that disables Chrome

> > > Refresh even if Customize Chrome is enabled. This allows us to set up a

> > > holdback experiment for the Customize Chrome side panel where both

> > > experiment arms have Chrome Refresh disabled.

> > >

> > > Things to note:

> > > * Only some Omnibox features need to be gated by Customize Chrome. This

> > > CL adds a helper to gate those specific call sites. The helper lives

> > > in //components/omnibox/common to work around cyclic dependency

> > > issues. This CL modifies DEPS rules accordingly.

> > > * This CL moves ntp_features into a new GN target so that users can

> > > depend on it in isolation. This, too, works around cyclic dependency

> > > issues.

> > >

> > > Bug: 1457991

> > > Change-Id: I13ccb0df1cfa433aa5e10bc2bca5a7933913da6d

> > > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4690991

entry.title: [WebGL] Remove WEBGL_webcodecs_video_frame extension
entry.content:
This extension was an early prototype what became WebGPU's ability to

import VideoFrames in zero-copy fashion. It proved too difficult to use,

and its spec is currently marked as "Do Not Implement" [1]. This CL

removes its implementation from Chromium and instead makes the extension

unsupported in Chromium. The concrete motivation for doing this now (in

addition to code cleanup) is that its per-texture accesses for each

separate plane of a multiplanar SharedImage are problematic for our

introduction of Multiplanar SharedImage (which has only one texture for

the entire image).



Bug: 1462924

Change-Id: I08ace73456843c1b53ffc378bbf6e6c3adb446e2

arguments.

entry.title: [iOS] Trigger the SU interstitital reloading
entry.content:
When a URL filter has been updated for a supervised

user (SU), we check whether we need to refresh a currently

shown blocking interstitial (in case of a block site

approval) or whether we need to trigger an intersitial

creation (in case of new blocking configuration).



A new method, `GetInterstitialType` is added on the

`IOSSecurityInterstitialPage` class, to allow our

use case to distinguish SU interstitials from other

managed security interstitials.

entry.title: [ios] Change Signin completion callback to receive full result and info
entry.content:
Previously the completion callback only received a BOOL to indicate

whether the signin was completed successfully. But in some cases, more

information is needed. In the case of the SetUpList signin item, swipe

to dismiss should be treated differently than the user actively

cancelling the signin by using the secondary button. Since the block now

receives the result, it can differentiate between success, cancels, and

interruptions.

entry.title: Remove data wipe logic from BrowserDataMigrator.
entry.content:
Data wipe logic was originally introduced in crrev.com/c/2853023 to

ensure that data created before enabling the new AccountManager (in

crrev.com/c/2859408) is not used with Lacros after enabling it. This was

done in M92.



Since crrev.com/c/3233747 in M97, `BrowserDataMigrator` started marking

the completion of profile migration in "Local State" under pref

`lacros.profile_migration_completed_for_user`. Unless the completion is

marked, profile migration will run wiping pre-existing Lacros directory.



Now users with data created by Lacros older than M92 will have to go

through profile migration once the OS is updated to >= M97 even without

data wipe logic. This makes the data wipe logic redundant.



So we remove the data wipe logic.



Test: tast run $DUT lacros.Migrate*

Bug: 1464834

Change-Id: Ic27f430f8c873508e8d746c986e4c40746882bbc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4686592

entry.title: [sync] Support GetUploadToGoogleState() in transport mode
entry.content:
Currently, SyncService::GetPreferredDataTypes() has good semantics in

all cases (signed out, transport mode, full-sync mode) and there is no

reason for GetUploadToGoogleState() to require that sync-the-feature is

enabled.



Theoretically, this relaxes the requirements for the predicate, but

in most cases (maybe all) it shouldn't make a difference (until

syncer::kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is enabled).

entry.title: Distinguish better between updating and filling in PasswordFormManager.
entry.content:
This CL contains no functional changes - it only moves functionality

between methods to have them do fewer things. In particular, it aims to

make it clearer which methods trigger filling.



1) Renames PasswordFormManager::Fill() to FillNow() and makes it

private, since it is not used externally outside of tests.



2) Introduces a new method call Fill() that triggers FillNow() if

predictions are available or DelayedFill() if they are not.



3) Splits up PasswordFormManager::FillForm().

FillForm() currently does a plethora of things:

- It checks whether the FormData passed as an argument differs

from the observed form and records metrics about the difference.

- Depending on the result, it updates PasswordFormManager to observe

a the new form.

- It calls fill (either directly or delayed) depending on a number of

factors (whether there was an update, whether there are predictions

after the update, whether the form manager is already waiting for

new predictions).



After the CL, callers need to do three things

- Call HasObservedFormChanged() to check whether an update is needed.

- Call (the existing method) UpdateFormManagerWithFormChanges().

- Call Fill().



This adds only a couple of lines in PasswordManager code, but it makes

it explicitly what is happening and will allow for easier reuse to

implement updates for dynamic form changes not detected by the

renderer path.



Finally, the CL adds unit tests for HasObservedFormChanged.





Bug: 1465803

Change-Id: I8d701f152ba1a7210b2c83b589d6d6e02a07d793

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4710605

Reviewed-by: Vasilii Sukhanov

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

Reviewed-by: Maria Kazinova

entry.title: Use a QUEUED TaskEnv and its RunUntilIdle
entry.content:
The new Rust-based JSON parser runs in a threadpool, instead of a

separate process, and this changes its behavior with respect to

RunUntilIdle. Processing threadpool tasks in QUEUED fashion, and running

the task environment until it is idle, work around these issues.

entry.title: [Password Manager] Handle Ctrl+F event only on Passwords page
entry.content:
Built in search works only on Passwords page and doesn't allow to

search on password details page. For users with hundreds of passwords

grouped under a single domain it might be a problem. This CL allows them

to use Ctrl+F on details page to use the browser built-in search.

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Move showPrerenderingAnimation to adaptive toolbar
entry.content:
Move showPrerenderingAnimation to adaptive toolbar as secondary toolbar

also has a progress bar. ToolbarCoordinator will call the method on both

toolbars but only the one with the omnibox will run the animation.



When bottom omnibox flag is disabled, secondary toolbar doesn't have a

progress bar and doesn't never has the omnibox.

entry.title: Fix a rare crash during a session creation
entry.content:
If the hosting system is under a heavy load it can happen that the

browser startup timeout expires before the DevToolsHttpClient kicks in.

Before this commit ChromeDriver skipped the part with the

DevToolsHttpClient use but it tried to execute the following code that

depended on the data received from the DevToolsHttpClient.

With this commit the code is able to detect such a situation and stop

its execution with a SessionNotCreated error.



Bug: 1467496

entry.title: Reland "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5f2a690589d8aaaa71181560acc2d70150773037.



Reason for revert: The revert of another CL fixed test failure. This CL is not related.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"

>

> This reverts commit f0db7b86166ef32ecdfbcb2a72e4a0abe6189db8.

>

> Reason for revert: Seems to be causing multiple failures:

> crbug.com/1467734

>

> Original change's description:

> > [customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code

> >

> > Chrome Refresh requires the Customize Chrome side panel. This CL ensures

> > that Chrome Refresh is only enabled if Customize Chrome is enabled, too.

> >

> > Additionally, this CL introduces a new feature flag that disables Chrome

> > Refresh even if Customize Chrome is enabled. This allows us to set up a

> > holdback experiment for the Customize Chrome side panel where both

> > experiment arms have Chrome Refresh disabled.

> >

> > Things to note:

> > * Only some Omnibox features need to be gated by Customize Chrome. This

> > CL adds a helper to gate those specific call sites. The helper lives

> > in //components/omnibox/common to work around cyclic dependency

> > issues. This CL modifies DEPS rules accordingly.

> > * This CL moves ntp_features into a new GN target so that users can

> > depend on it in isolation. This, too, works around cyclic dependency

> > issues.

> >

> > Bug: 1457991

> > Change-Id: I13ccb0df1cfa433aa5e10bc2bca5a7933913da6d

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4690991

> > Auto-Submit: Tibor Goldschwendt

> > Commit-Queue: Tibor Goldschwendt

> > Reviewed-by: manuk hovanesian

> > Reviewed-by: Dana Fried

> > Code-Coverage: Findit

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175187}
